articles.title: Congratulations to Italian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Italian President
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Giorgio Napolitano upon his reelection as president of Italy.
					 Kim in his message wished the Italian president success in his work for the socio-economic stability and development, expressing belief that the DPRK-Italy ties would grow stronger in mutual interests.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Sends Condolences to Chinese Premier
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Sends Condolences to Chinese Premier
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Monday sent a condolatory message to Li Keqiang, premier of the State Council of China, in connection with the earthquake that hit Sichuan Province, claiming huge casualties and material loss.
					 Expressing deep sympathy and condolences to the Chinese government and people, victims and their bereaved families, the message hoped that the people in the afflicted area would eradiate the aftermath of the natural disasters at an early date and lead a stable life under the leadership of the Communist Party and government of China.

articles.title: Religionists Blame U.S., S. Korea for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Religionists Blame U.S., S. Korea for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang April 22 (KCNA) -- An emergency meeting of the Religious Believers Council of Korea took place here Monday as the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase, being engaged in sanctions and pressure on the DPRK despite their lip-service for "dialogue".
					  Present at the meeting were chairman, vice-chairmen, permanent members and members of the council and representatives of organizations of religious fraternities at all levels in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The meeting set "On dynamically waging nationwide protest movement for immediately ending the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' moves for confrontation with the DPRK" as its theme.
					
					 Jang Jae On, chairman of the Council who is also chairman of the Central Committee of the Catholic Association of Korea, made a keynote address. Pastor O Kyong U, secretary general of the Central Committee of the Christian Federation of Korea, Ryo Jong Son, secretary general of the Central Guidance Committee of the Chondoist Association of Korea and the chief priest of Songbul Temple, who are all members of the Central Committee of the council, made speeches.
					
					 The speakers said that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities have escalated confrontation with the DPRK and hostility toward it after adopting a "resolution on sanctions" by abusing the UN Security Council over the peaceful satellite launch by a sovereign state. They branded this as a planned provocation to escalate the tension.
					
					 The proposal for dialogue and negotiations made by those who are directly responsible for the escalating tension has greatly infuriated all the religious believers of the DPRK, the speakers said.
					
					 Not only Koreans and the world progressives but American religious leaders and other people with differing political views and religious belief have appreciated the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, they said, adding: The public at home and abroad are increasing voices praising the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un as the father of the nation, a lodestar of national reunification and great men.
					
					 At this time the confrontation maniacs of south Korea are behaving foolish to cover the sun in the sky. These men without the soul of the nation should be certainly forced to pay a dear price.
					
					 The Korean nation can never evade the catastrophic disaster nor can they lead a peaceful religious life as long as the group of Satan is left intact.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are trying to turn the Kaesong Industrial Zone into a hotbed of a war, they said, dismissing "dialogue for normalization of operation" as absurd.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean authorities have true intent of dialogue and negotiations, they should immediately stop all provocative moves and make full apology.
					
					 An appeal to the believers in south Korea and abroad was adopted.
					
					 The appeal said that now is the time for religionists loving peace and justice to opt for practical actions, not just making words.
					
					 It called on religionists in south Korea and abroad to clearly see through the nature of thrice-cursed crimes of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean military gangsters keen on inflicting a nuclear holocaust on the nation and turn out in a just action.

articles.title: Delegation of European Politicians Here
articles.content:
Delegation of European Politicians Here
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe headed by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell, former Downing Street Chief of Staff to Prime Minister, arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Director-General of IIJI Leaves
articles.content:
Director-General of IIJI Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Director-General of the International Institute of the Juche Idea Vishwanath who is also secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council, flew back on Monday.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Rejects U.S., S. Korea's Dialogue Offer as Insincere
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Rejects U.S., S. Korea's Dialogue Offer as Insincere
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and puppet south Korea are making nonsense as to the principled conditions for talks set by the DPRK.
					 The White House spokesman told reporters on April 18 that the U.S. is still of the stand to hold "trustworthy and sincere" negotiations with north Korea, saying that its attitude is insincere.
					
					 The puppet south Korean regime also made impudent remarks that "the south wants the north will discontinue assertion that sanctions should be repealed, and go down the road of wise option."
					
					 It was only recently that they cried out for "punishment", being keen on "preemptive nuclear attack" exercises, blustering that dialogue and negotiations will never help the north dismantle its nuclear program. It is really disgusting that they are now painting themselves as proponents of dialogue. This is a revelation of their invariable confrontation policy to cover up their attempt to ignite a war and stifle the DPRK at any cost.
					
					 "Dismantlement of nukes first" and implementation of the "resolutions on sanctions" set forth by the hostile forces as preconditions for dialogue are aimed to force the DPRK to lay down arms and bring it into submission.
					
					 The U.S. considers the Korean Peninsula a strategic bridgehead for attaining its ambition for world domination. To put the Asia-Pacific region under its control, it needs to conquer Korea and, to this end, it has to render the DPRK militarily ineffective by employing every possible means and method. 
					
					 Prompted by this calculation, the U.S. has constantly been engaged in the dangerous nuclear blackmail and sanctions against the DPRK for decades and whenever their political and military circumstances did not get their way, they made dialogue offer.
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the U.S. used the six-party talks as leverage for realizing its ambition for stifling the DPRK.
					
					 The dialogue rhetoric and war moves on the part of the U.S. are both aimed at stifling the DPRK. Therefore, they are an open challenge to the DPRK and a declaration of showdown with it.
					
					 The DPRK is clear and fixed in its stand and will. It will respond to the U.S. and other hostile forces' vicious moves for confrontation with it with the consolidation of nuclear force for self-defence and the toughest confrontation with the U.S. No appeasement and deception will ever work on the DPRK.
					
					 The hostile forces should clearly understand that their intensified confrontation moves will touch off bitterer counterattack from the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. Hostile Actions against DPRK Will End in Shameful Fiasco: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Hostile Actions against DPRK Will End in Shameful Fiasco: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. trigger-happy forces should draw a lesson from the shameful defeat it suffered after attacking the young DPRK on the basis of its miscalculation in  the 1950s and would be well advised  not to misjudge it, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					 Since the U.S. and its south Korean puppet forces inked "the joint plan for coping with the provocation of a local war ", the situation on the Korean Peninsula has reached a more alarming phase. 
					
					 The danger and gravity of the plan lie in that it provided the U.S. with a legal and institutional mechanism to get its aggressor forces automatically involved in local armed conflict between the north and the south.
					
					 As a matter of fact, this plan makes it possible for the U.S. to go to a war by mobilizing its nuclear war hardware in its mainland and the Pacific region.
					
					 The present Obama Administration is going in the direction of stepping up its hostile policy toward the DPRK, far from drawing a lesson from the failure of this policy.
					
					 It is making desperate efforts for fear that its policy will totally go bust if the DPRK, a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, achieves even economic prosperity by building a thriving nation.
					
					 It is a legitimate right of the DPRK to self-defence to take countermeasures now that it has become clear that the U.S. scenario for a nuclear war has reached the phase of its implementation which nothing can stop.
					
					 The DPRK does not want a war but is compelled to stand up against the aggressors as they are trying to impose the war upon it.
					
					 The DPRK, however, has nothing to fear.
					
					 If the U.S. preempts an attack, misjudging its rival again, its strongholds will be blown up.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Bolstering Nuclear Deterrence
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Bolstering Nuclear Deterrence
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will never abandon its nuclear deterrence for self-defence but further bolster it as long as the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces remain in south Korea and persist in their moves to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article. It goes on:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea set forth the line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and building of nuclear force. This is essentially required by the prevailing situation where the destiny of the nation is seriously threatened and a stumbling block is lying in the way of national reunification due to the U.S. and other hostile forces' extreme "sanctions" racket and moves for a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has built powerful nuclear deterrent, weathering all difficulties, in order to cope with the U.S. escalating nuclear threat. This was a very just option to shatter the U.S. vicious aggression moves and racket against national reunification and pave a wide avenue for hewing out the independent destiny.
					
					 An access to powerful war deterrent provides a sure guarantee for defending the sovereignty of the nation in the present world under the reign of the law of jungle.
					
					 The sovereignty and supreme interests of the DPRK are now facing a grave challenge.  The Korean Peninsula will be engulfed in the flames of a nuclear war in a moment if the DPRK acts like those countries in the Balkans and Middle East which fell victim to aggression after abandoning war deterrent while reading faces of big powers. 
					
					 If one is strong, one has nothing to fear in face of any formidable enemy and one can surely meet one's demand and interests under any situation and circumstances.
					
					 The powerful nuclear deterrent of the DPRK serves as matchless strength to firmly defend the destiny and dignity of the nation from outsiders' interference and aggression and meet all challenges of anti-reunification forces and a precious treasure of the nation which can never be bartered for anything.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez hosted a reception at his embassy on Monday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Ui Chun, Minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador said in his address at the reception that the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung serves as an example not only for the Korean people but for the world revolutionary people.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, brilliant successor to the revolutionary cause of general secretary Kim Jong Il, is wisely leading the Korean people, he said, and went on:
					
					 I am convinced that the DPRK will certainly emerge victorious in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country.
					
					 The ambassador paid highest tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and sincerely wished Kim Jong Un bigger success in his work steering the Korean people.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop in his speech lauded Kim Il Sung defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialisms and built a socialist power on this land.
					
					 He recalled that Kim Il Sung together with Fidel Castro, Rau Castro and Che Guevara provided the tradition of friendship between the DPRK and Cuba.
					
					 He extended thanks to the Cuban people for having voiced invariable support and solidarity for the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 Kim Il Sung will always be alive in the hearts of the Korean people and the world revolutionary people, he stressed.

articles.title: National Festival of Science, Technology to Be Held
articles.content:
National Festival of Science, Technology to Be Held
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The 28th National Festival of Science and Technology will take place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here from April 23 to 30.
					 According to Ryo Thae Gun, an official of the C.C., General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea, the festival will witness more than 530 pieces of sci-tech achievements gained in various economic sectors, including coal, power and metal industries and railway transport.
					
					 The forthcoming festival will focus on the technological exchange in a diversified way, which includes swap of diverse know-how and exchange of some 200 kinds of intellectual and advanced products. Services for new technologies and products will also be available.

articles.title: New Kind of Portable Heating Bag Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kind of Portable Heating Bag Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A new kind of portable heating bag was developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The bag is heated up to more than 50 degrees centigrade when friction is made for one or two minuets. It generates heat for 1,500 minutes.
					
					 What is noticeable is that the bag radiates far infrared rays and anion.
					
					 Ro Hye Ok, a Pyongyang citizen, told KCNA that she felt relieved from pain after using the bag.
					
					 Kim Song Hyon, manager of the Kumchon Exports Production Company, said his company would soon begin making portable cooling bags, too.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Genius in Military Affairs
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Genius in Military Affairs
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- From his early days of revolutionary activities, President Kim Il Sung had paid priority to military affairs.
					 On the basis of unique line that Korea's liberation could be achieved only by force of arms, he organized the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) and launched an anti-Japanese armed struggle to liberate the country.
					
					 After the country's liberation, he developed the KPRA into the Korean People's Army, a regular army. Under his guidance, the KPA in the Korean War (1950-1953) defeated the U.S. imperialists, who boasted of being the strongest in the world.
					
					 He set forth a self-defensive military line of making the entire army a cadre army, modernizing it, putting all the people under arms and turning the whole country into a fortress. He also advanced a unique line of simultaneously carrying on economic and defence buildup.
					
					 Thanks to his illustrious guidance to that effect, the KPA turned into a-match-for-a-hundred forces and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea rose to fame as a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence.
					
					 In the early 1990s, Kim Il Sung handed over the KPA supreme commandership to general secretary Kim Jong Il, possessed of unparalleled qualification and virtue as befitting a brilliant commander, thus settling the issue of succession to the cause of army building.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's assumption of office as KPA supreme commander was what Kim Il Sung had thought of from long ago. It also represented the unanimous will and desire of the servicepersons and civilians.
					
					 By pursuing the Songun (military-first) politics, Kim Jong Il deterred anti-DPRK offensives launched by the U.S.-led imperialists, and creditably defended Korean-style socialism centered on popular masses.
					
					 The enduring feats the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in army building are now being successfully carried forward by respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Slams Plan for War
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Slams Plan for War
						
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea held a press conference outside the building of the "Ministry of Defense" on April 18 at which it called for rescinding the war plan. 
					 The speakers at the press conference held that the "joint plan for coping with the provocation of a local war" worked out by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities calls on the U.S. to get automatically involved in a local war on the Korean Peninsula so that it may jointly cope with the war together with the puppet forces.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 The plan is fraught with the danger of even a small spark on the peninsula developing into an all-out war.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean authorities truly want dialogue with the north, they should drop the joint plan and dismantle the U.S.-made nuclear weapons for offensive.
					
					 It is illogical to talk about the establishment of a peace-keeping mechanism on the peninsula, while allowing "Minister of Defense" Kim Kwan Jin, signatory to the plan, to stay in his office.
					
					 The present regime should show its true will for dialogue in practice, not verbally.

articles.title: South Korean Organizations Call for National Reunification
articles.content:
South Korean Organizations Call for National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- South Korean Organizations including the Society of April Revolution and the Solidarity for Progress held a joint memorial service at the cemetery of the April 19 Democracy in Seoul on April 19, the 53rd anniversary of the April 19 Popular Uprising.
					 At the ceremony the speakers said that the uprisers brought dictator Syngman Rhee to ruin, not yielding to the suppression at the point of bayonet, and made shouts of slogans for democracy and peaceful reunification resound forth all over south Korea.
					
					 But dictator Park Chung-Hee staged the May 16 military coup, quelling the desire of the people for democracy and ushering in the dark period of the "yusin" dictatorship, they deplored, and went on:
					
					 The people are now worried about the fact that the present "government" is following in the footsteps of the Lee Myung Bak regime that brought democracy, people's living and inter-Korean relations to a collapse.
					
					 They called for putting an end to war and achieving national reunification by the efforts of the people, noting that the spirit of the April 19 popular uprising for independence, democracy and reunification is enshrined in their hearts thanks to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: S. Korea to Stage North-targeted War Drills
articles.content:
S. Korea to Stage North-targeted War Drills
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The 16th flying corps of the south Korean air force is mulling staging drills for taking off and landing on an emergency runway in Yongju, North Kyongsang Province on April 25, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers plan such mad-cap drills under the pretext of coping with the wartime situation with their base's runway destroyed.
					
					 It was reported that various type warplanes including F-15K, KF-16, F-4E, F-5E, CN-235 and KT-1 would be involved in the drills.
					
					 Shortly ago, the 19th flying corps stationed in Chungju, North Chungchong Province frantically staged four day-long north-targeted drills.
					
					 The unending north-targeted saber-rattling is further increasing the danger of war.

articles.title: U.S. Call for Dialogue Is Trick to Deceive Int'l Community: News Analyst
articles.content:
U.S. Call for Dialogue Is Trick to Deceive Int'l Community: News Analyst
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- High-ranking U.S. officials have recently called for dialogue and negotiations, urging the DPRK to show its "will for denuclearization" as a precondition for them.
					 This is tantamount to challenge to the line of the Workers' Party of Korea on simultaneously carrying on the economic construction and the building of nuclear forces, which is legalized as one of the DPRK's laws.
					
					 The U.S. has no face to call for denuclearization.
					
					 In actuality, the DPRK proposed the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula against the U.S. nuclear threat to it and had paid big efforts to that effect.
					
					 In April 1959, the DPRK Government warned the U.S. of turning south Korea into a nuclear arsenal and offered a proposal for making Asia a nuclear-free zone.
					
					 In the hope of seeing the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, it joined the Non-proliferation Treaty in 1985. In the 1990s, it signed with south Korea a joint declaration on the denuclearization of the peninsula in a bid to defend the nation's security from the U.S. nuclear threat and made every possible effort for its implementation.
					
					 However, the U.S. has persistently threatened the DPRK with nukes, constantly creating a danger of nuclear war to the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Soon after the DPRK conducted a nuclear test as self-defensive countermeasure, the U.S. launched Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills against the DPRK with mobilization of what it calls the three strategic nuclear strike means.
					
					 B-52 and B-2A bombers flew to the sky above south Korea to stage an exercise for dropping nuclear bombs while nuclear-powered submarines sailed to the waters off south Korea to attend the drills.
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to prove that the U.S. call for the denuclearization of the peninsula is no more than a trick to deceive the international community. 
					
					 The facts have forced the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrent, a guarantee for the nation's security. 
					
					 The U.S. can never expect any dialogue for denuclearization with the DPRK unless it abandons its nukes.
					
					 Genuine dialogue is possible only at the phase where the DPRK has acquired nuclear deterrent enough to defuse the U.S. threat of nuclear war, unless the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy and nuclear threat and blackmail against the former.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was celebrated in different countries from April 11 to 13. Meeting, seminar, round-table talks, film shows and book, photo and fine art exhibition took place in Britain, Romania, Mongolia, Vietnam, Cambodia and Uganda.
					 Korean films shown included "Always in the Hearts of Humankind".
					
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said that Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, liberated the country, freeing the Korean people from the yoke of colonial slavery.
					
					 He was an outstanding strategist who led the Korean war to victory. 
					
					 The Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) is convinced that the Korean people will win a final victory in the all-out action against the U.S. imperialists and achieve the cause of national reunification without fail, true to the behests of Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, single-mindedly united around the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The deputy director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Kim Il Sung firmly maintained the principles of Juche in idea, independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence, laying a solid foundation for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 The DPRK has stood firm against the imperialists' moves to stifle it thanks to the capability for self-defence bolstered up by Kim Il Sung, he added.
					
					 The rector of College of Culture of Mongolia said that the world people are admiring the distinguished political caliber, matchless grit and pluck of Kim Jong Un, the creditable successor to the cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, and his personality as an outstanding strategist.

articles.title: Important Anniversaries of DPRK Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Important Anniversaries of DPRK Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Bangladesh, Poland and France from April 12 to 15 to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 20th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the first anniversaries of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's election to the top posts of the party and state.
					 Present there were personages of relevant countries and the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea and masses.
					
					 The general secretary of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea praised Kim Il Sung, saying humankind will always remember the feats performed by him for the cause of independence against imperialism.
					
					 He expressed conviction that the Korean people would surely achieve victory in the standoff with the U.S. under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association noted that the DPRK can stand firm against the U.S. as Kim Il Sung bolstered up the national power in every way and Kim Jong Il built nuclear deterrence.
					
					 The Korean people are sure to triumph in nuclear stand-off with the U.S. imperialists and the building of a thriving nation as they are led by Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of the preceding leaders, the chairman stressed.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the France-Korea Friendship Association praised Kim Il Sung as a peerless patriot who liberated the country from the colonial yoke, built a rich and powerful independent state and dedicated his all to the cause of national reunification till the last moment of his life.
					
					 He expressed support for the Korean people in their all-out action to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country, rallied close around Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Poland.

articles.title: Philippine Organizations Slam U.S. Nuclear War Moves against DPRK
articles.content:
Philippine Organizations Slam U.S. Nuclear War Moves against DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula and the Philippine preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War made public a joint statement on April 7 in denunciation of the U.S. imperialists' nuclear war moves against the DPRK.
					 The statement accused the U.S. of staging frantic nuclear war exercises in south Korea with huge forces and ultra-modern war hardware involved with an aim to stifle the DPRK and, furthermore, establish domination over the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 The DPRK has the right to bolster up its nuclear deterrence to protect the country and its people, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. is a stumbling block in the way of the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.
					
					 We call for the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. for putting a definite end to the Korean war.
					
					 We also urge the U.S. to pull its aggression troops and nuclear weapons out of south Korea.

articles.title: Peerlessly Great Men of Mt. Paektu Lauded by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Peerlessly Great Men of Mt. Paektu Lauded by Foreign Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Organizations of different countries posted special write-ups on their websites on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association in an article posted on its website on April 10 praised Kim Il Sung for performing immortal feats on behalf of the country and the revolution. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 He was a great man with the highest prestige in the history of the Korean nation spanning 5 000 years.
					
					 He proved in practice that national independence can be achieved and a true power for the people can be built only through an armed struggle.
					
					 General secretary Kim Jong Il developed the Juche idea founded by the President, providing an eternal foundation for the building of a socialist thriving nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, is successfully carrying forward the Songun politics.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il said in an article posted on its website on the same day:
					
					 The immortal feats of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu whose august names are shining as the sun will last forever.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will surely reunify the country and build a thriving nation thanks to the unshakable will of Songun, matchless grit and ever-victorious leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on April 7 said in an article titled "The great man admired by the world" that the President was a peerlessly great man, dealing with facts about the profound respect expressed by heads of state and prominent figures of various countries for him.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Rally, Demonstration Held in Russia
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Rally, Demonstration Held in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A rally and demonstration took place outside the U.S. embassy in Moscow on April 14 in protest against the U.S. imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK
					 They were attended by deputies to the State Duma of Russia, personages of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Moscow City Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League and the group for solidarity with the DPRK and masses.
					
					 At the rally speakers said that the imperialist aggressors will never escape powerful strikes of the DPRK, expressing indignation at the moves of the  U.S. and its followers to ignite a war.
					
					 The DPRK encourages the world progressives in their will to stand up against the U.S. high-handed practices, they noted, adding the DPRK, the fortress of socialism, will triumph and communists of Russia wish the DPRK victory. They voiced solidarity with its army and people in their struggle to defend its sovereignty.
					
					 A statement was adopted at the rally. It said:
					
					 The DPRK is a popular socialist country.
					
					 The U.S.-led imperialist forces are making all desperate efforts to trample down the Korean people's freedom.
					
					 We regard it as our duty to support the Korean people in their struggle to defend their freedom and independence.
					
					 We protest against the U.S. aggression moves.
					
					 The Korean people have the right to decide how to live and which way they should go. 
					
					 A solidarity demonstration of people from all walks of life was staged on the road outside the DPRK embassy in Moscow on April 15.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Called for
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Called for
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Various civic and social organizations in south Korea launched a Wednesday action for peace against war and in demand of the withdrawal of U.S. troops from south Korea outside the U.S. Forces Command in Seoul on April 17. They included the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and its Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience.
					 At a ceremony of declaring the action the speakers said the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula calls for rooting out the source of constant danger of war which has lasted for the past six decades since the armistice.
					
					 They continued:  The U.S. occupied south Korea, depriving its people of their right to existence and sovereignty. Not content with this, it seeks to bring the whole of Korea under its control. 
					
					 It is necessary to see through and lay bare the true colors of the U.S. forces present in south Korea.  
					
					 It was none other than the U.S. troops in south Korea who mercilessly killed people on Jeju Island who staged an action against "separate elections and separate government" in demand of setting up a unified government. It was again the U.S. troops who ignited the Korean war and massacred millions of Koreans.
					
					 They held that the U.S. forces should be forced out of south Korea as early as possible as they are still present there without dropping the imperialist ulterior aim for hegemony.
					
					 A statement for the occasion was read out there.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Brazil
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "The Working Class Should Become the Pivotal Force in the Struggle for Modeling the Whole of Society on the Juche Idea" was posted on the website of the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on April 15.
					 The work, published on Nov. 30, Juche 70 (1981), clarifies successes achieved by the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea in the past and sets forth tasks facing it to model the whole society on the Juche idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was published in booklet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on April 14.
					 The work, published on April 27, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il in land administration and indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the land as befitting a socialist thriving nation.

articles.title: Day of Sun Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Day of Sun Observed by Foreign Media 
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Magazines and newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 The April issue of Magazine of Hong Kong, China International Ties said in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, shining august name":
					
					 The august name of Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, means the sun.
					
					 He embarked upon the road of the revolutionary struggle for liberating the country from the Japanese imperialists' occupation in his teens and founded the Juche idea, Songun idea.
					
					 He waged a protracted anti-Japanese armed struggle, liberating the country and founding a country of the people. He inflicted the first defeat in history upon the U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world and brought about a victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He led the social revolution of two stages and socialist construction of various phases to victory, setting a worldwide example in the struggle to achieve the independence of the popular masses.
					
					 He, at the same time, positively supported the struggle for national liberation, the anti-imperialist struggle and the building of a new society in different countries.
					
					 The Juche idea founded by him is recognized as the idea guiding the human cause of independence.
					
					 His august name is shining as an eternal banner for victory and the truth and invincibility of the Juche idea have been more clearly proved as the time goes by.
					
					 The April 10-17 issue of the Russian newspaper Khabarovski Ekspres said in an article titled "Invulnerable fortress defending the people" that the Korean revolutionary armed forces founded by the President worked a historic miracle of defeating the two formidable enemies -- U.S. and Japanese imperialisms.
					
					 The Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional on March 31 and the April issue of the Peruvian newspaper Accion Nacionalista praised the revolutionary life and feats of the President.

articles.title: Convocada reunion urgente de Consejo de Religiosos de Corea
articles.content:
Convocada reunion urgente de Consejo de Religiosos de Corea
 Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en esta capital una reunion urgente del Consejo de los Religiosos de Corea en relacion con que Estados Unidos y las autoridades del Sur de Corea siguen recurriendo a la sancion y presion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en medio de la propuesta del "dialogo" llevando asia la fase peor la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					 Estuvieron presentes alli el presidente, vicepresidentes, miembros permanentes y miembros, del CEC y delegados de todas las organizaciones religiosas en esta ciudad y otras localidades.
					
					 En la reunion se debatio el tema "Para desarrollar con vigor el movimiento pannacional de protesta a fin de detener de inmediato los actos conflictivos de Estados Unidos y las autoridades del Sur de Corea contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea".
					
					 Jang Jae On, presidente del CEC y del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Catolicos de Corea, pronuncio un discurso principal y el sacerdote O Kyong U, secretario general del CC de la Federacion de Cristianos de Corea, Ryo Jong Son, secretario del Comite de Direccion Central de la Asociacion de Chondoistas de Corea y el jefe de monjes budistas del templo Songbul, quienes son miembros del Comite Central.
					
					 Los oradores condenaron a las autoridades norteamericanas y surcoreanas que al cuestionar el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos del Estado soberano, instigaron a la ONU a aprobar una "resolucion de sancion" e inculcan la confrontacion fratricida y hostilidad para exacerbar la situacion.
					
					 Dijeron que los fautores principales de la exacerbacion de la situacion hablan descaradamente del dialogo y negociaciones, lo cual provoca la indignacion de todos los creyentes de la RPDC.
					
					 Senalaron que tanto la nacion coreana y la humanidad progresista del mundo como las personalidades de distintos sectores con diferentes criterios politicos y creencia religiosa  incluyendo el lider religioso de EE.UU. reconocen las inmortales hazanas de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y les veneran al Mariscal Kim Jong Un como padre de la nacion y el salvador de la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					 Precisamente en este tiempo, los maniacos conflictivos surcoreanos actuan astutamente para ofender la maxima dignidad de la nacion coreana, dijeron y agregaron que deben liquidar hasta el fin la cuenta con ellos.
					
					 Dejar intacta a la banda satanica la nacion coreana no podra evitar las tragicas calamidades ni gozar de la pacifica vida religiosa, aseveraron.
					
					 Las autoridades surcoreanas hablan del "dialogo por la normalizacion de administracion" de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong convirtiendola en el peligroso foco de guerra, lo cual no pasa de ser una artimana, revelaron.
					
					 Si EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas desean de veras el dialogo y negociaciones, deberan poner fin de inmediato a todas las acciones provocativas y pedir disculpa por el respecto, demandaron.
					
					 En la reunion fue aprobado el llamamiento a los religiosos del Sur de Corea y en ultramar.
					
					 El documento senala que ahora es el tiempo en que los religiosos amantes de la paz y la justicia deben levantarse en la accion practica.
					
					 Exhorta a los religiosos surcoreanos y en ultramar a levantarse en la justa lucha distinguiendo correctamente el imperdonable crimen de EE.UU. y los gangsteres del circulo militar surcoreano que intentan traer a la nacion coreana las calamidades nucleares.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por efemeride coreana
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por efemeride coreana
 Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de Cuba en Corea, ofrecio el dia 22 una recepcion en su sede diplomatica.
					 A la comida fueron invitados Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Jong Suk, presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, y otros funcionarios.
					
					 En su discurso, el embajador dijo que la vida revolucionaria del Presidente sirve de un valioso ejemplo no solo para el pueblo coreano sino tambien para otros revolucionarios del mundo.
					
					 Se refirio a que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, quien continua con brillantez la causa revolucionaria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, esta dirigiendo sabiamente al pueblo coreano.
					
					 Expreso su conviccion de que la RPDC saldra siempre victoriosa en su lucha por construir un Estado prospero socialista y reunificar la patria.
					
					 Rindio el mas sublime homenaje a los Generalisimos y deseo al Mariscal mayores exitos en su labor para dirigir al pueblo coreano.
					
					 A su vez, Yang Hyong Sop senalo que el Presidente vencio a los dos imperialismos yanqui y japones y levanto sobre este territorio la potencia socialista.
					
					 Prosiguio que junto con los companeros Fidel Castro, Raul Castro y Che Guevara, el Presidente preparo la tradicion de amistad entre la RPDC y Cuba.
					
					 Agradecio al pueblo cubano que envia el invariable apoyo y solidaridad con la justa causa del pueblo coreano.
					
					 Destaco que el Presidente estara vivo para siempre en el corazon del pueblo coreano y los otros revolucionarios del mundo entero.

articles.title: ACNC revela artimana de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACNC revela artimana de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
 Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- En estos dias, Estados Unidos y los titeres surcoreanos censuran las demandas de principios de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 El dia 18, el vocero de la Casa Blanca, en una rueda de prensa, dijo que EE.UU. esta dispuesto a negociar de "manera fidedigna y sincera" con el Norte de Corea, pero no es sincera la actitud de este.
					
					 Tambien los titeres surcoreanos parlotearon con absurdidad que "el Norte (de Corea) tomara una opcion sabia abandonando su demanda de revocar primero las sanciones".
					
					 Hasta hace unos dias ellos se entregaban al "castigo" y al entrenamiento de "ataque preventivo nuclear" contra la RPDC diciendo que es imposible lograr la renuncia de armas nucleares del Norte con el dialogo y negociaciones, pero de repente se disfrazan de "partidarios a dialogo" para encubrir su intencion de provocar la guerra y aplastar a toda costa detras de esa cortina a la RPDC, lo que es la continuacion de su invariable politica conflictiva.
					
					 "Renunciar las armas nucleares primero" y el respeto a "resoluciones de sancion", presentados como premisa para el dialogo, persiguen desarmarla y doblegarla.
					
					 EE.UU. considera la Peninsula Coreana como trampolin estrategico para la realizacion de su ambicion de hegemonia mundial. La estrategia  de este imperio es ocupar Corea para controlar la region de Asia-Pacifico y para ese fin hay que desarmar a la RPDC movilizando todos los medios y metodos.
					
					 Partiendo de esa estrategia, el imperio yanqui vino valiendose durante varios decenios de los peligrosos chantajes nucleares y las sanciones contra la RPDC y solian hablar del dialogo cada vez que se tornaba desfavorable la situacion politica-militar.
					
					 Todo el mundo conoce bien que EE.UU. vino aprovechando tambien las conversaciones a 6 bandas como palanca para realizar su ambicion de aplastar a la RPDC. 
					
					 Ya que el dialogo y las maniobras militares se dirigen a aplastar la RPDC, estos son un desafio abierto a esta y una expresion de la naturaleza conflictiva.
					
					 Es clara la respuesta de la RPDC al respecto. Es inconmovible la voluntad de la RPDC de enfrentarse a las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y otras fuerzas enemigas con las contramedidas superduras tales como el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares, y nadie podra detenerlo con cualquier aplacamiento y engano.
					
					 Las fuerzas hostiles deben tener presente que sus siniestras maniobras conflictivas chocaran con la rotunda contraofensiva del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea.

articles.title: Acto hostil anti-RPDC de EE. UU.  terminara con derrota amarga, asevera Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Acto hostil anti-RPDC de EE. UU.   terminara con derrota amarga, asevera Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- Las fuerzas belicistas de Estados Unidos deben sacar una leccion merecida en su derrota sufrida en la decada de los 50 del siglo pasado tras invadir con el juicio erroneo a la joven Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 Asi inicia el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este lunes, y prosigue:
					
					 La situacion de la Peninsula Coreana corre hacia la fase pesima una vez que los yanquis y los titeres surcoreanos suscribieron el "plan de operaciones conjuntas para hacer frente a la provocacion local", lo cual permite tener a este imperio el aparato legal e institucional para introducir automaticamente sus tropas agresoras en el caso de que se produzcan los choques armados locales entre ambas partes coreanas. He aqui la peligrosidad y gravedad del citado plan.
					
					 En actualidad, segun ese plan EE.UU. entra en el estado de guerra movilizando los pertrechos de guerra nuclear de sus tropas agresoras en su territorio principal y el Pacifico.
					
					 La actual administracion de Obama persigue ejecutar forzosamente su politica hostil anti-RPDC en vez de sacar la leccion en esa politica  fracasada.
					
					 El imperio yanqui hace esfuerzos desesperados al presentir que su politica hostil anti-RPDC no podra evitar el fracaso total en el caso de que la RPDC, digno pais poseedor de armas nucleares, logre hasta la prosperidad economica mediante la construccion de un estado prospero.
					
					 Es el legitimo derecho de autodefensa de la RPDC tomar las medidas correspondientes dado que el plan de guerra nuclear del imperio entro en la infrenable etapa practica.
					
					 No deseamos la guerra, pero nos enfrentaremos categoricamente a los agresores si estos nos imponen la guerra.
					
					 No tememos nada en este mundo. 
					
					 Si EE.UU. desencadena la guerra al juzgar mal a su contraparte, seran arrasados limpiamente los nidos de los agresores.
